snippet: To the extent that 21st Century Fox’s unrequited bid for Time Warner Inc. offered a crystal ball on the future of media, print doesn’t seem as if it will be much a part of it.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column argues that 21st Century Fox's unrequited bid for Time Warner Inc points up the decline of print in the media business; notes that both companies, built on magazines and newspapers, have shed all of their print assets in recent years; examines his own growing dependence on digital media and the less contemplative attitudes it engenders.
lead_paragraph: To the extent that 21st Century Fox’s unrequited bid for Time Warner Inc. offered a crystal ball on the future of media, print doesn’t seem as if it will be much a part of it.

headline.main: Riding the Juggernaut That Left Print Behind
headline.print_headline: Riding the Juggernaut That Left Print Behind
